      • saveInstanceState

        <T> void saveInstanceState(T target,
                           Bundle state)
        Save the given target in the passed in Bundle.
        Parameters:
        target - The object containing fields annotated with State.
        state - The object is saved into this bundle.

      • restoreInstanceState

        <T> void restoreInstanceState(T target,
                              Bundle state)
        Restore the given target from the passed in Bundle.
        Parameters:
        target - The object containing fields annotated with State.
        state - The object is being restored from this bundle. Nothing is restored if the argument is null.

      • saveInstanceState

        <T extends View> Parcelable saveInstanceState(T target,
                                              Parcelable state)
        Save the state of the given view and the other state inside of the returned Parcelable.
        Parameters:
        target - The view containing fields annotated with State.
        state - The super state of the parent class of the view. Usually it isn't null.
        Returns:
        A parcelable containing the view's state and its super state.

      • restoreInstanceState

                                                 Parcelable state)
        Restore the sate of the given view and return the super state of the parent class.
        Parameters:
        target - The view containing fields annotated with State.
        state - The parcelable containing the view's state and its super sate.
        Returns:
        The super state of teh parent class of the view. Usually it isn't null.

      • setEnabledForAllActivitiesAndSupportFragments

        void setEnabledForAllActivitiesAndSupportFragments(Application application,
                                                   boolean enabled)
        Turns automatic instance saving on or off for all activities and fragments from the support library. This avoids manual calls of saveInstanceState(Object, Bundle) and restoreInstanceState(Object, Bundle), instead the library is doing this automatically for you. It's still necessary to annotate fields with State, though.

        The best place to turn on this feature is in your Application#onCreate() method.
        Parameters:
        application - Your application instance.
        enabled - Whether this feature should be enabled.
